intro: Senecio urundensis, commonly known as the Urundensis groundsels, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with similar climates.
